intro: Tetrastigma subtetragonum, commonly known as the four-cornered grapevine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with four lobes, giving it its scientific name. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers and red berries that are edible but not widely cultivated. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
